reviewText: This is one of the best Thomas the tank engine & friends videos that was on the market.It contains 6 fourth season episodes with a fourth season song.1.The first episode is "Mind That Bike" in where Tom Tipper The Postman's van gets to expensive and now has to use a bike to deliver mail all over the Island.2.The second episode is "Train Stops Play" in where Stepney The Bluebell Engine accidentally gets a cricket ball stuck in his freight car and gives the cricket players a chase in there old car Caroline.3.The third episode is "Thomas Meets The Queen" in where the Queen of England is coming and Henry is going to pull the special train, but has a accident and now Thomas and Gordon have to set things right in time.4.The fourth episode is "Bulls Eyes" in where Daisy teases Toby about his cowcatchers and side-plates, but Toby gets the last laugh when Daisy meets a real Bull.5.The fifth episode is "Special Funnel" in where Peter Sam's funnel is loose and eventually gets knocked off and his new funnel is quite a surprise!6.The sixth and final episode is "Four Little Engines" in where Sir Handel has an accident with some coaches and it's up to Skarloey to get the passengers to the station even if he pops a spring!SONG:The song is the "Island Song" the most dramatic and epic song Thomas has to offer!If you have the chance to get this VHS YOU MUST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Recently, i have felt to increase my season 1/season 2 collection of Thomas The tank engine, i have purchased UK VHS's to get the complete Ringo Starr UK Narration! Ringo was always my favorite narrator! I remember watching shining time station as a kid, and i loved the stories! But due to whatever Ringo Never re-did all 52 episodes for the US audience which led to George Carlin finishing and re-narrating all of the first season which leads him to many people to favor George Carlin in the US! But for me Ringo had the better narration for the first two seasons! But anyways this was one of my first thomas VHS's i got the strand home video version first, and i played it so much i wore it out, and then i got the Strand VCI verison in 2003! The stories on this VHS like all american thomas is not released in broadcast order in a sense, but keeps stories together. We Start off with Better Late than never, about thomas trying to deal with repairs on the viaduct, for the rest of the second season we would see the viaduct under repair, but on this episode aired after all the other Episodes but yet it is the opening one! Then We go into the trilogy about Duck and Diesel, and how duck ends up in a predicament in the barbers shop, which led to Sir Topham Hat telling duck he never believed Disel and he wants him back home in the yard. Now 5 of the episodes are season 2 episodes, and the opening episode is a season 2 episode giving us the ONLY US Season 2 opening, after this we skipped to Season 3 intros! While Thomas breaks the rules was a season 2 release with season two style nameboards and stuff, it still had a season 1 intro! So the next two stories on this release were season 1, one of my favorites Gordon Takes a Dip, where gordon thinks hes too important to pull a freight train and runs into a ditch, and Down the Mine where Thomas i cheeky to gordon and then needs his help to get out of the mine. The next episode which did air before the other two season 2 episodes was MY FAVORITE thomas episode growing up, THE RUNAWAY! I don't know what it is about, but theres still a lot of nostalgia with that episode! Now when i was a kid i had the Strand Home Video version, but i played it so much the VHS got warped during Gordon takes a dip, and down the mine and The Runaway. Then i purchased the strand VCI entertainment version as a replacement and now have found the original cover verison! There should have been another Ringo Starr VHS after this one in the US, there was 6/7(if you count the version of thomas and the missing christmas tree on tis a gift). For whatever reason Tenders and turntales, Thomas breaks the rules and better late than never was discontinued, and trust thomas showed that another ringo starr RS US VHS would never be released! Its to bad, but luck has been on our side because a high quality verison of Percy takes the Plunge, A New Friend for Thomas, and Saved from Scrap have been released on DVD! I would give this VHS 20/10. Even with all the UK RS stuff i do have this VHS will always be the best..
summary: Still my Favorite Thomas VHS even if its not made anymore
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Gallant Old Engine is a great Thomas video and all the stories are fantastic, but my personal favorite is Fish. It's like The Flying Kipper only with Duck helping Henry. I am a big fan of Henry and this was a great story for the Henry fans. Anyway, I'll tell you about the rest of the stories: In HENRY AND THE ELEPHANT find out what surprise awaits Henry when he takes some workman to clear out a tunnel of a rather mysterious object. In YOU CAN'T WIN see how Stuart and Falcon get to help old Duke when he can't pull his passenger train by himself. In SPECIAL ATTRACTION, Toby is on his way to the carnival as the special attraction. But when he gets there, someone tells him that the carnival doesn't need a special attraction after all. In PASSENGERS AND POLISH, Duncan is mad that he didn't get polished and decides to come to a standstill on the viaduct while pulling passengers. In GALLANT OLD ENGINE, find out how Rheneas saves the railway and welcome him home when he finally comes back from the works. And in FISH, see what happens to Duck when he helps Henry with the Flying Kipper and ends up in a very fishy situation. The music video on this tape is "REALLY USEFUL ENGINE", a cute song about everyone's favorite #1 blue engine, Thomas. I'd recommend this Thomas video, you'll enjoy it. :)

reviewText: Wow! I finally have the first stories of the little Diesel named Rusty as well as the other little engines. It shows how the Deisel saved an engine named Stepney from scrap and how Stepney was first introduced on Sir Topham Hatt's railway. This is certainly worth seeing.
summary: At last! The first story of Rusty the Diesel.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A Thomas fan once, a Thomas Fan for life--or that is how I feel about my son's favorite character. This collection of Thomas stories is great. A direct interpretation from the original stories, it brings the characters from the book alive. My son loves it. On a separate note, the live animation and lack of a lot of special effects is a refreshing change from a lot of the other kids movies out there. It lets kids' imagination to develop and that is why I think that my son watches this tape over and over and over....
summary: A Must-See for the Little Thomas Addicts

reviewText: I thought this was a great video and it has good episodes but it really didn't stand out from any of the other ones. Mind that Bike was a boring episode for older people to have to watch and I was diasppointed to see Bulls Eyes and have it be not so good. This is a old tape and it was Daisy's most recent performance and she's only had two other ones. Thomas Meets the Queen acts after Gordon and Thomas's accidents in Better Late than Never but it was a good episode. Special Funnel shows Peter Sam getting his new funnel which i'm sure he already had. This was a good tape but I thought a bunch of other ones were better.
summary: A great tape but it was missing something

reviewText: Better Late Than Never is a great VHS to own Some great jewels in this assortment of Season 1 and Season 2 episodes. The story stops are...Better Late Than Never 5/5Pop Goes The Diesel 3/5Diesel's Devious Deed 3.5/5A Close Shave for Duck 4/5Gordon Takes a Dip 4.5/5Down the Mine 3.5/5The Runaway 5/5On this tape, you're introduced to Diesel the Devious Diesel, learn about the Alliance made by Thomas and Gordon, see Duck get a beard, and much more. Highly recommended tape.NARRATTED BY RINGO STARR
